snippet: Some analysts have called the visit by Eric E. Schmidt of Google naïve, while others describe it as valuable back-channel diplomacy at a time of strained relations between Washington and Pyongyang.
abstract: Visit to North Korea by Eric E Schmidt, Google's executive chairman, and former New Mexico Gov Bill Richardson may be used by Kim Jong-un to burnish his image at home and show people that his impoverished nation is moving forward; some in United States are calling visit naive while others describe it as valuable back-channel diplomacy.

byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea, Claire Cain Miller from San Francisco, and Edward Wong from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Some analysts have called the visit by Eric E. Schmidt of Google naïve, while others describe it as valuable back-channel diplomacy at a time of strained relations between Washington and Pyongyang.

headline.seo: Visit by Google Chairman May Benefit North Korea
headline.main: Visit by Google Chairman May Benefit North Korea
headline.print_headline: Visit by Google Chairman May Benefit North Korea
